thread.title: Juan Mata drags weary Manchester United into Europa League quarter-finals - but win came at a price
thread.title_full: Juan Mata drags weary Manchester United into Europa League quarter-finals - but win came at a price

author: David Anderson
title: Juan Mata drags weary Manchester United into Europa League quarter-finals - but win came at a price
text:
Juan Mata celebrates with his team-mates (Photo: Ross Kinnaird) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Juant Mata dragged weary United into the last eight after a tough night at Old Trafford. 
United looked like they were running on empty before Mata produced a moment of magic in the 70th minute to break the deadlock and finish off Rostov’s resistance. 
Boss Jose Mourinho was just about to take Mata off when the Spaniard scored to take his tally for the season to 10 goals. 
United needed a brilliant save from Sergio Romero late on to deny Rostov. 
The win came at a cost as Paul Pogba and Daley Blind were forced off injured as their punishing schedule took its toll. 
But United will just be relieved to make it to the last eight of the competition for the first time since 1985 and keep alive a route into the Champions League. 
Mourinho fielded a virtual full-strength side in a sign of how seriously he is now treating the Europa League. 
In contrast, Rostov were so ravaged by injury and suspensions that coach Ivan Daniliants could only name four substitutes, one of whom was a goalkeeper. Mata breaks the deadlock (Photo: Matthew Peters) 
United huffed and puffed at Rostov’s massed yellow ranks and went close when Marcos Rojo got his head to Blind’s corner, forcing Nikita Medvedev into a decent save. 
The Rostov keeper parried Rojo’s header and Zlatan Ibrahimovic hit the post from the rebound. 
Medvedev caused panic in the Rostov defence when he rushed out to challenge Ibrahimovic and the Swede rounded him, only to loft his effort over the bar from a narrow angle. The erratic Medvedev was fortunate not to concede a penalty when he pushed Henrikh Mkhitaryan in the back challenging for a high ball. 
United were getting closer and Ibrahimovic cut inside before hitting a right-foot shot against the post with Medvedev beaten. Somehow Rostov managed to withstand this siege. Paul Pogba leaves the pitch with a hamstring injury (Photo: Man Utd via Getty Images) 
The crowd were growing frustrated and they expected goals after witnessing 12 in United’s previous four home games in the Europa League. Pogba had been quiet, but came to life just before half-time when he hit a left-foot curler, which was saved by Medvedev. 
But he was forced off with a suspected pull to his right hamstring. 
Rostov’s game plan was to defend in numbers and hit United on the break. 
And it nearly brought them the opening goal when Sardar Azmoun, dubbed the ‘Iranian Messi’, cut inside Rojo and hit a left-foot shot, which Romero pushed away. 
Romero also saved from Christian Noboa and Rostov grew in confidence. Marcos Rojo eats a banana during the game (Photo: Stu Forster) 
Mourinho was just about to replace Mata with Marcus Rashford when he won the ball in midfield to launch a counter-attack. 
Mkhitaryan crossed and Ibrahimovic back-heeled it on for Mata to score at the back post. 
Rostov knew a goal would take the tie into extra-time and they almost grabbed it late on only for Romero to make a superb save from Aleksandr Bukharov’s glancing header. Like us on Facebook
